summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding victim notification procedures in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It discusses coordination with Epstein's counsel, specifically mentioning attorney Jack Goldberger, and indicates the DOJ wanted to delay sending notifications until clearance was obtained to file a document.

persons.name: Acosta, Alex
persons.context: Recipient of an email regarding victim notification procedures in the Epstein case. He is being updated on the status and asked if a delay poses problems.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Identified as the contact person for any civil litigation related to the case. His signature was on a proposed victim notification document provided to Epstein's counsel.

connections.description: Goldberger is identified as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein, as the proposed victim notification was provided to 'Epstein's counsel' and Goldberger is the designated contact.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is involved in a legal process where Goldberger, as Epstein's attorney, is the designated contact for civil litigation matters.

events.title: Proposed Victim Notification Shared
events.description: A proposed victim notification document, signed by Jack Goldberger, was provided to Jeffrey Epstein's legal counsel.

events.title: DOJ Requests Delay in Notification
events.description: The Department of Justice requested a hold on sending out victim notifications until clearance was obtained to file an unspecified document later that day.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing victim notifications in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of July 2008.
Epstein's counsel, including attorney Jack Goldberger, was involved in the notification process, having been provided a proposed document.
The Department of Justice (DOJ) instructed a delay in sending notifications pending clearance to file another document.
The correspondence shows coordination between federal prosecutors (including Alex Acosta) and Epstein's defense team regarding victim procedures.
